  <ol style="margin-top: 6px; margin-bottom: 10px;">
    <li>A firm commitment IPO means the issuer guarantees the shares will be sold</li>

  </ol>

  <strong style="display: block;">Which statements are FALSE?</strong>

  <label><input type="radio" name="module1_multia_q32" value="A"> A. 1 and 2</label><br>

<div id="feedback-module1_multia_q32" class="feedback" data-status="" style="display:none;">
âœ… Correct: D. All three statements are false.
Why the false statements are false:
- (1) In a firm commitment IPO, the underwriter (not the issuer) bears the placement risk by committing to purchase the shares.
- (2) In a best efforts IPO, the underwriter does not guarantee selling all shares; it only agrees to use its best effort to place them.
- (3) Firm commitment reduces placement risk, but underwriters still face price/market risk when reselling the shares.
